Get a report on important parts of your system so you can get an overview of it quickly.

{{{
wget http://aspersa.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/summary
bash summary
# ONE-STEP METHOD ###################
wget -O- http://aspersa.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/summary |bash
}}}

Goals:

  * Give a quick view so you can decide what to dig into further.
  * Compact output; try not to line-wrap on an 80-character terminal.
  * Be as diff-able as possible so you can compare systems (or changes to the same system).
  * Work well on GNU/Linux.
  * Require only bare-bones tools such as 'sed' and 'grep' to be available.

Usage:

  * Just wget and execute (see top of page)
  * Set ASPERSA_SKIP environment variable to control it (command-line options can't work with one-step execution):
    * It is a comma-separated string, with any combination of options allowed.
    * Possible options are MOUNT,NETWORK,PROCESS
